job vacancy village leap village leap provides a way for a rural village to bridge the digital divide, by bringing beautiful handmades silk products woven in cambodia to you. we hope you enjoy our website. village leap king norodom sihanouk admires silk scarf produced by robib villagers, with queen monineath, behind the king, holding another scarf, during a visit to the royal palace by bernard krisher, chairman of american assistance for cambodia and his wife, akiko on december 5, 2000. on receiving the scarves the king called in the palace television crew to describe the beauty of the scarves and robib project. the queen commented they are of very high quality. the segment was shown for about minutes over national tv. village leap provides a way for a rural village to bridge the digital divide, by bringing beautiful handmades silk products woven in cambodia to you. we hope you enjoy our website. robib is one village and also every village in the world robib is a group of six small villages in a remote, practically inaccessible area of cambodia. in fact it is every such village in the world. its situation reflects the poverty, isolation, health hazards and limited educational and commercial opportunities that is the fate of the overwhelming population of the world. but is doesnt have to be that way. the internet now offers leapfrogging opportunities to take such villages out of their isolation and poverty into our global village. thus the name of this site: villageleap.com why com and not org? because, though this project aims to show that a small village such as robib has tremendous untapped assets and potential skills to fulfill computer-generated assignments, to produce and market hand-made products, to access information, to communicate its views to anywhere in the world and to enjoy better health care via the internet, one of the aims is to help the people of robib prosper through cyber commerce. a system has been set up so that credit card orders can be filled and goods shipped out via ems express mail service of the post office) and reach robibs customers anywhere on the globe within one or two weeks. a supporter, the hotel okura in tokyo, is absorbing the credit card commission so the people of robib will not lose in the transaction. now more about robib:. robib is some nine and a half hours north of the capital of phnom penh, with our old, but reliable, toyota pickup truck over some good but mostly very bumpy dirty roads. our staff usually drives up first to kampong thom, the nearest sizeable town, which is still about two hours away and stays there overnight, completing the journey bright and early the following morning. robib consists of six smaller villages: vieng cheung 603), tang trak 1001), khnang malou bak kadoung 783), beung 304) and romou 362). the annual average per capita income of the villagers is around some earn as much as but many only earn in a year! the villagers harvest rice only once a year and it is barely sufficient to feed their families. there is no surplus. in bad years or when there is a flood there is not enough to go around. the farmers also grow vegetables and corn which they sell at the local market. robib has a health center but there is a shortage of medicine. seriously ill patients have no access to expert medical care so little chance to survive. a representative from a foreign non- governmental medical organization, which the villagers can only identify a ah, visits the village once a month and treats patients at the health center but they must purchase any drugs that are prescribed. a single taxi, operated by a villager, is the main means of transportation in and out of robib. it leaves early every morning for kampong thom and returns in the evening. the taxi is always full. until two years ago there was no taxi at all and villagers found it difficult to travel. sometimes if a military truck is in the region they could hitch rides. they have no means of selling their vegetables outside the village. there is no electricity, plumbing nor phone lines. a call can be made to kampong thom or to phnom penh only by radio. the radio equipment in phnom penh is set up at one electronic shop near the central market where one can make or receive calls by setting up the time in advance with the parties one wishes to call who then stand by at the telecommunications center in robib. a call of any durations costs the reception is not always clear. the children population of the robib villages, according to the district chief, is around 2,000. no exact figures exist yet for this year. literacy barely reading and writing) is claimed to be percent but comprehension is low; the average education of older people is only up to around the 4th grade level. today children begin school at the age of six. they attend primary school for six years and some move on to five more years of schooling in college. fortunately robib is clear of landmines though other communes in the region are vulnerable to mines left from the series of foreign and civil wars the country suffered through over the past four decades. like most of rural cambodia, robibs population is vulnerable to malaria, tb and some tropical diseases. aids which is growing uncontrollably in the larger urban centers, has fortunately not hit robib due to its isolation. robib was under the control of the khmer rouges from to 1979. subsequently the khmer rouges moved out of the village itself but remained posted about seven kilometers away, blocking the village from access to the outside. in the khmer rouges began to disintegrate and the population gradually returned to a life without fear. many of its followers still living in the village have been absorbed without apparent rancor. the french, in colonizing indochina, established an educational system and robib had its first school from then. all schools were closed and education stopped under the khmer rouges regime in the 1970s. teaching was resumed here and in most of cambodia only a decade ago but poorly; many children have been reduced to studying in old, unsafe school buildings or under the trees for the lack of structures. opportunities for the children of robib are limited. most continue to farm. the artistic skills, such as weaving, have been lost but now are being relearned. those who leave for the cities can expect at best to do very menial low-paying work or become cyclo drivers, sending their very meager incomes back home to support their families. if some children can be educated to benefit from their knowledge of computers, english and in maneuvering the internet, the future prospect of bringing computer-related work into villages such as robib can raise the economic level and well being of its people. we are in the process of helping to construct rural schools in cambodian villages such as robib, under a matching-fund program where donors contribute to build a three-to-five room school with their name on it and this contribution is matched by the world bank through cambodias social fund, for an additional the donor may add an optional to cover the cost of solar panels, placed on the roof, which provide sufficient energy to operate a computer by apple-japan, the mit media laboratory, deutsche bank in tokyo and several others) for five-six hours a day so the schoolchildren can get some training in working with computers. a school in robib with computers and now internet access, was built in november with funds donated by ms. wakako hironaka, a member of the japanese parliament and former minister of the environment. in neighboring villages to robib two other schools were opened on the same day, also equipped with a computer each, funded respectively by nicholas negroponte, the director of the mit media laboratory, and the other by the shintoshin rotary club in shinjuku, tokyo. children in these villages are taught how to use computers by orphans aged to who have mastered computer literacy and internet surfing over the past year and a half at a computer center we helped to establish at the future light orphanage in a village outside of phnom penh. the computer center was built with a donation from toshu fukami, chairman of world mate of japan who is also funding ten village schools. these orphans have been transferring to the rural schools, as they go up, where we have set up computers and teaching the other children and teachers how to work on a computer. for more information about the cambodia rural school project please look at our home page: www.cambodiaschools.com and for more information about the children at the future light orphanage, who rotate to robib to teach their classmates what they know about computers and the internetor to send e-mail to these childrensee: www.futurelight.org to send e-mail to the children at the hironaka school in robib write to: hironakaschool@yahoo.com in july 2000, with the cooperation of the ministry of posts and telecommunications of cambodia, shin satellite corp. of thailand member of the shinawatra group) generously loaned to robib a satellite dish and set up an internet connection from the village to its satellite over cambodia which linked the village school into the internet and all that such a connection offers. some critics have chided us for bringing computers and the internet to such a poor, remote, backward village when the people there primarily need more food, clothing and health care. my answer is why not both? i hope you will agree, log into this site often and support the village by ordering its product as a sign that a real link can be established between such villages and us. bernard krisher, chairman american assistance for cambodia/japan relief for cambodia bernie@media.mit.edu thus the villagers of robib are in the process of training now to make beautiful silk objects and sell them to you silk weaving project this hopefully will become a model for villages all over the world which can watch robib and learn how to adapt some of its leapfrogs in its race toward a better life. about us faq our assistance for cambodia/japan relief for cambodia thousands of the rural poor in cambodia, struggle to meet their basic needs due to poverty. many have no access to health care and a large number of rural children are unable to receive an education because there is no school. sometimes even when there is a school some children, often girls, cant go to school because their families are so poor that they are forced to work instead. there are also orphans who have lost their parents to hiv/aids and no one is there to take care of them. wafc and jrfc are independent nonprofit organizations dedicated to providing opportunities for the youth and rural poor in cambodia. world assistance for cambodia is registered in the united states as a 501(c) tax-deductible nonprofit organization. within cambodia, wafc/jrfc is recognized by the cambodian government as one nonprofit organization. mission world assistance for cambodia japan relief for cambodia is an independent, nonprofit organization dedicated to improving opportunities for the youth and rural poor in cambodia. wafc/jrfc operates interlinked programs across cambodia in the areas of education, health, rural development, and technology. job title director of childrens advocacy and development job description live in placement in prek eng drive outside of phnom penh) at the bright future kids home new life foster care center with children from the ages of 5-19. there are two tracks in which children come to live at the center. the children coming in as a new life foster child has one or both parents who have died of hiv/aids and have no relatives who can take care of them. the children in the bright future kids program come from the rural areas where there is no high school. they are scholarship students who are academically talented and stay at the center while attending high school in phnom penh. duties create lesson plans and teach english classes to the kids residing at the bfkh center some additional students from the village) helping fellow caretakers with daily administrative work for the childrens school, dentist, doctor etc.) facilitating activities for the children at the bfkh orphanage bright future kids village leap sihanouk hospital center of hope about faq give photo gallery gba-waiting list job vacancy the rural school project in rural cambodia, hundreds of villages still lack a functional primary and secondary school. through world assistance for cambodias rural schools project,private donors from all over the world have helped construct over primary and secondary schools in rural cambodia. build a school world assistance for cambodia/japan relief for cambodia, in partnership with the cambodian ministry of education youth and sports, builds schools in poor, remote villages all over cambodia. after the completion of a school building, the ministry provides licensed teachers to teach the compulsory national curriculum at the school. enrollment is open to the public and is free of charge. school sign board a donor who contributes toward cost of building a school can name it. the cost of building a brand new three-room school with furnishings and toilets is a donor wishing to sponsor and name a school that was built by matching funds but that is already completed can do so for a school built through world assistance for cambodia can be further enhanced by support of additional programs such as the english/computer training programs, vegetable gardens, the girls be ambitious program to help keep girls in school and scholarship programs for high-achieving students who would like to benefit from further education. solar panels six solar panels are affixed atop a roof of a school that runs multiple computers for the english/computer classes operated by world assistance for cambodia/japan relief for cambodia. three solar panels can power up to three low-energy computers for an average of nine hours a day. the cost of installing three solar panels is teaching computer skills an english/computer teacher at the mortgage force school in koh kong province instructs a student. donors may sponsor english/computer classes to a school theyve funded the construction or to any other school built through world assistance for cambodias program. to set up an english/computer program, hardware such as low energy computers that run a khmer open source operating system and keyboard a unit), solar panels to power the computers for three panels) and internet for two years of gprs or a satellite connection for for two years) are initially added. the annual on-going costs are the english/computer teachers salary for and the annual cost of the internet subscription. by adding an english/computer program, students, the teacher and the donor can exchange e-mails and digital. the computer program also makes it possible to operate other programs such as the vegetable garden and girls be ambitious program that are monitored by the english/computer teacher. water well a group of students at the kirivorn school in koh kong province pump the water well located on the grounds of the school. the water is used for drinking, cooking, watering the vegetable garden and for the toilets. under cambodian law, all wells must be accessible to the public. residents of the kirivorn village use this well to pump water for their own use. the cost to dig an additional well is to depending on the depth. carrying water to drink students at the kirivorn school in koh kong province carry water from the well to fill the hagar water filters in the class rooms to make the water safe for drinking. hagar water filter a hagar water filter in a classroom at the kirivorn school in koh kong province purifies the water to make it safe to drink. the cost of adding two hagar water filters is vegetable garden early in the morning, student volunteers help tend the vegetable garden at the rieko yano school in prey veng province. the vegetables are used as ingredients for a meal prepared for the students by a cook in the school kitchen served before their classes. the initial set up cost of a garden is that includes preparing the soil for growing vegetables, seeds, fertilizer, construction of a kitchen, utensils, cooking ingredients and the salaries of one gardener and one cook for two years. from the third year, the annual ongoing cost to support the gardener, cook, seeds and ingredients is vegetable garden students volunteer at the rieko yano school in prey veng province to help tend a vegetable garden at their school. the vegetables are used fora pre-school meal. at the end of the school year,student volunteers receive a certificate of service learning. kitchen when a vegetable garden program is started, a small outdoor kitchen for the cook to prepare the meals for the students is built on the school grounds. cook early in the morning, the cook at the rieko yano school in prey veng province lays out the ingredients that include vegetables grown in the garden on the counter of the kitchen in preparation to cook a meal that will be eaten by students before the start of classes. serving breakfast students at the rieko yano school in prey veng province help themselves to the morning soup made from freshly picked vegetables grown in the garden. eating breakfast students at the rieko yano school in prey veng province sit down together and enjoy their soup for breakfast. morning gathering at a.m., at the start of the school day, the deputy principal of the rieko yano school in prey veng province call upon the students to gather in front of the school to salute the national flag and sing the national anthem. library an addition of a library, provides a quiet and calm space where students can enjoy a choice of quality reading material and study on their own. the cost to build librarybuilding witha square meter floor space, ten tall bookshelves, four large tables and chairs is about is the suggested budget to fill a new library with age-appropriate khmer-language fiction, non-fiction and reference books. here at the kirivorn school library, students browse through newly donated books from nishimachi international school, the sponsors of the school and library. harry potter in khmer a primary school student at the kirivorn school in koh kong province reads the khmer translation of harry potter in the school library. j.k. rowling, the author, donated the khmer translation rights to bernard krisher, founder of world assistance for cambodia/japan relief for cambodia to help encourage cambodian children to read. girls be ambitious eleven-year old moul somphors attends kirivorn school in koh kong province through the sponsorhip of the girls be ambitious program. conditions of poverty, make it difficult for girls like moul somphors to attend school because they are made to work in the fields, do chores or look after younger siblings. the girls be ambitious program awards participating families each month their daughter attains perfect school attendance for excuses absences such as illness and family emergencies. the can be used by the family to hire an adult to do the work previously assigned to the girl enabling her to attend school and gain literacy. bright future kids program kong doch and hen chanhong, both eighth graders receive full-scholarships to participate in the bright future kids program. highly-motivated, academically talented students from world assistance for cambodias primary schools are eligible to apply to this magnet scholarship program. the monthly scholarship support is a month or a year per student. bright future kids program chhem bunna is also eighth grader enrolled in the bright future kids program. bunna enjoys studying english, computer and science. during his free time he reads books about culture and history and plays sports. his dream is to one day become a doctor or a judge. prev next about improving opportunities for the youth and rural poor in cambodia. wafc/jrfc operates interlinked programs across cambodia in the areas of education, health, rural development, and technology. background the american journalist and long time resident of japan, bernard krisher, established japan relief for cambodia in to galvanize support to help rehabilitate cambodia, devastated by years of civil war. in he founded american assistance for cambodia, a us tax-exempt 501(c)(3) organization, to support his humanitarian projects in cambodia. in 2012, american assistance for cambodia changed its name to world assistance for cambodia to appropriately reflect its global support. our programs are operated in cambodia by world assistance for cambodia/japan relief for cambodia, a non-governmental organization recognized by the government of cambodia. i covered cambodia for newsweek in and am also a survivor of the nazi holocaust in germany where six million jews perished. because cambodia was completely devastated by the khmer rouge, i decided to put all my effort to help the cambodians recover and reconstruct their country through education and providing health services to the poor. the united states also inflicted great pain on cambodia by bombing and killing its population to wage the vietnam war. as an american, i felt it my duty to compensate the cambodians for the damage my country inflicted on them. king norodom sihanouk was gratified with my contribution to his country and has continuously praised the hospital, sihanouk hosptial center of hope and the more than rural schools that we helped to build. bernard krisher, june 2012. message from the prime minister message from the king about us faq our programs bright future kids girls be for orphans whose parents have died of hiv-aids the foster care and a new life center is a loving home for orphans and foster children in cambodia who have lost their parents to hiv-aids. during the pol pot period, many children were left parentless as nearly two million people perished from starvation, torture, and exhaustion under the cruel regime of the khmer rouge. nowadays, there are fewer genuine orphans but countless poor children whose parents are unable to care for them and who inhabit most of the countrys orphanages. in addition, a growing number of children are becoming orphans as their parents die from hiv/aids. these children are among the most vulnerable and in addition to poverty, many have experienced child abuse by their former caretakers. to give them a loving home and hopeful future, we established foster care and a new life center in 2007. currently, there are over children at our center, located on farmland on the outskirts of phnom penh. for the past decade the hodge schuyler family foundation has funded operations. the children here are physically healthy and not afflicted by hiv/aids. they attend a local state school and benefit from additional tutoring and enrichment classes after school at the center where they learn computer skills, english, music and dance, and participate in sports. we are very proud of the tremendous academic and personal growth we have seen in the children at our center and believe this is because they are well supported, and happy children learn and thrive. when our children turn 18, they leave the center and live independently. our program offers scholarships to universities and vocational training while providing support for independent living to make this transition successful. some of our graduates have chosen careers in teaching english and it at our rural schools, a prestigious and respected job in cambodia. why we care unfortunately, because there are many scam orphanages in cambodia where the care and living conditions are substandard, the response of the government has been to crackdown and close those orphanages. as there are only official social workers for the whole country, there is no working foster care system and those children end up on the streets. while our foster care center is a drop in the bucket to address this immense need, we strive to give the best support we can to our children, advocate for others to provide foster care,and to set an example. in addition to providing care for our children, we bring in experts in child psychology who deal with the issues our children face. our workshops are open to the public and to other ngos who wish to help the most vulnerable children in cambodia. about us faq our programs bright future kids girls be ambitious rural assistance for cambodia is an independent non profit organization dedicated to improving opportunities for the youth and rural poor in cambodia. frequently asked questions by our donors 1. w hat is the relationship between japan relief for cambodia and world assistance for cambodia? japan relief for cambodia was founded in by bernard krisher, an american journalist and long-time resident of japan, to help rehabilitate cambodia devastated by years of civil war. in 1998, he founded american assistance for cambodia, a us tax-exempt 501(c)(3) organization, to support his humanitarian projects in cambodia. in 2012, american assistance for cambodia changed its name to world assistance for cambodia to appropriately reflect its global support. programs for world assistance for cambodia and japan relief for cambodia are operated in cambodia by world assistance for cambodia/japan relief for cambodia, a non-governmental organization recognized by the government of cambodia. 2. what are your activities? we operate over half a dozen programs in cambodia: the rural schools project is a program to build schools, classrooms and libraries in the poor remote areas of cambodia. further enhancements such as computers and internet connection by solar energy), english and computer training, vegetable gardens, wells and water filters, and a school nurse are added to many of our schools. the girls be ambitious project enables girls who are unable to go to school due to conditions of poverty to attend one of our rural schools and receive an education instead of having to work in the fields, do chores at home or take care of siblings. the participating girls family receives a stipend at the end of each month when she has perfect attendance. the bright future kids is a full-scholarship magnet program for academically-talented students from our rural schools who wish to expand their education and become the future leaders of cambodia. a new life orphanage is a warm and nurturing home for orphans who have lost their parents to hiv/aids. the sihanouk hospital center of hope located in phnom penh, provides quality medical care to the poor free of charge. 3. how can i build a school in rural cambodia? world assistance for cambodia/japan relief for cambodia continues to look for sponsors to help build more schools and classrooms in cambodia for villages that currently lack a school. the cost to build a classroom with all the furniture and toilets for boys and girls is an entire school building is between three to five classrooms to once we have received the full funding, we begin construction. school construction takes approximately three to six months from start to completion. however, there is sometimes a delay in the construction depending on the season and location. 4. how are locations selected? since the beginning of our rural schools project, we choose a site for each new school in areas of greatest need at the time. we work with the cambodian ministry of education that conducts an annual whole nation survey to determine where those areas are. our schools are in villages that are very remote and lack a school in the near vicinity. 5. what types of schools can be built? schools are three- to five-room brick and concrete buildings. the first schools built were primary schools to 6), while new schools are currently lower secondary to 9). all of our schools are officially approved and managed by the ministry of education. 6. who maintains the school? all of our schools are official cambodian state schools. the government maintains the building and pays for state teachers. all of the improvement features that we have listed such as adding a computer/english program, a vegetable garden, or a school nurse are managed and maintained by world assistance for cambodia/japan relief for cambodia staff through the generosity of our donors. 7. what curriculum do the schools follow? the english and computer classes are managed by world assistance for cambodia/japan relief for cambodia. all other curricula are determined by the cambodian ministry of education. 8. how many students attend a typical school? schools typically hold to students. some schools are built on the same facility as a separate school, such as a primary school sharing a campus with a secondary school. 9. how are school teachers paid? there are two types of teachers: world assistance for cambodia/japan relief for cambodia full-time english/computer teachers and state teachers. world assistance for cambodia/japan relief for cambodia full-time teachers are recruited out of university or our orphanage, trained by world assistance for cambodia/japan relief for cambodia and fully employed by world assistance for cambodia/japan relief for cambodia. state teachers are employed by the government. 10. how do i choose which school improvements to add? we strongly encourage the addition of the basic education improvements english/computer training program teacher, bookcases, books, water filters and vegetable gardens. 11. can i sponsor an english/computer program at one of the schools built by one of your other donors and can i have a relationship with that school? you may add and support improvements to one of our rural schools that does not yet have the benefit of enhancement available through our organization, such as an english/computer program, vegetable garden, school nurse, water filter, etc. sponsors of school improvements may have ongoing exchanges with the school, such as e-mail correspondences and digital photo exchanges, scrapbook exchanges and visits to the school. 12. how can i visit the school i sponsored? please let us know the dates you wish to visit. we can help arrange for an insured air-conditioned hired car to take visitors to a school. we will assign a program officer to guide and interpret. there is a per diem for the accompanying program officer, which can be paid after the visit by check or credit card to our organization. 13. i would like to attend my school opening. who can come to the ceremony? can someone help with my travel plans? what are the associated costs? what can i expect? can i bring gifts for the first visit of a donor to their school, we arrange an opening or dedication ceremony. the ceremony is a very important event for the members of the school and the village. when planning for an opening or dedication ceremony, please let us know the date that you wish to hold the ceremony so we can let the villagers who will help arrange the ceremony have enough time to prepare. donors and any guests they invite are welcome to attend the ceremony. we can assist in hiring an insured air-conditioned vehicle to take the attendees to the school on the day of the ceremony. a program officer from our organization will meet and accompany the donors to the school, interpret the speeches during the ceremony and during the tour of the school. we also invite local authorities and related provincial officials, villagers, teachers and children to join the ceremony. we cannot predict how many villagers and participants will attend. to prepare for the ceremony, the villagers build a platform and canopy for the guests to protect them from the sun or the rain. the full cost, about is shared by the donor and the villagers, and we ask the donor to contribute towards the platform. all costs associated with an opening ceremony that we arranged, such as hiring a car, platform for the ceremony or any gifts for distribution at the ceremony that were purchased through us, may be reimbursed to us later by check or credit card after the ceremony and after the visitors return back to their home country. the ceremony usually begins in the morning and lasts for about one hour during which donors and attending officials give speeches. after the ceremony, the donor takes a tour of the school. many donors choose to distribute gifts at this time. popular gifts are a set of school supplies distributed to each child and sports equipment to be shared by all the students. donors can go to the market to purchase these themselves or we can purchase these for the donor in advance. 14. i would like to sponsor girls at a particular school to participate in the girls be ambitious project. can i do that? any school that has a computer/english teacher, who also monitors the attendance of girls be ambitious participants, is eligible to take girls into the girls be ambitious program. you may sponsor a girl in the village who meets the criteria to participate for a year. 15. can i have a panel/e-mail relationship with the girl i am sponsoring through the girls be ambitious project? because most of the girls who join the girls be ambitious program have not had any or much schooling prior to participating in the program, in most cases the girls basic literacy skills are still developing and they are not able to acquire computer skills right away. however, we can and have arranged visits for donors to meet their girl at her school and visit her home. if you are visiting cambodia and would like to meet the girl you are sponsoring, please contact us and we will help arrange for you to meet your girl. 16. can i sponsor an academically-talented student to further their potential? we can facilitate scholarship support to motivated and academically-talented students who are currently attending one of our rural schools. you may support a student from one of our schools to participate in the bright future kids program or support a middle school student to continue on to high school in a provincial town. annual scholarships are a month). we will send you a profile of a bright and promising student that the director of the bright future kids program has personally screened for admission to the program. we are always happy to arrange visits to meet your student and for donors to correspond by e-mail with their sponsored student. 17. how can i supporta new life orphanage? you can become a sponsor of an orphan for a month or a year, which covers the orphans food, clothing, school supplies and medical costs. we are also collecting funds to hire tutors, buy toys, books, sports equipment and to build additional facilities. sponsors will receive a full profile of their orphan. the orphanage is located amidst nature in kandal province, about minutes by car from central phnom penh. visits are always very welcome. we also have a comfortable guest house for guests who wish to stay overnight. 18. where does world assistance for cambodia/japan relief for cambodia raise money from? we receive donations from a number of sources. the majority of our donations come from individual donors and families. we also receive donations from foundations, corporations, international organizations, civic groups and government agencies. 19. how can i donate? we accept check, wire transfer, paypal and credit-card donations. please see our donation page for more details. 20. how can i get a tax deduction in the us? world assistance for cambodia is a certified 501(c)(3) tax-deductible organization in the united states. the federal tax ein id number is 51-0350058. 21. i want a tax deduction, but live in a country other than the us. what should i do? if you live in canada, you can wire transfer to the us account listed on the website. a canadian donating to a us charity can get a 75% deduction from their personal us-sourced income and they can carry the deduction forward up to five years. we do not provide tax deductions for donations from other countries. if you live in england or australia, please c ontact u s about how you may receive deductions for your donation. 22. i would like to hold a fundraiser to contribute to your projects. does world assistance for cambodia/japan relief for cambodia have promotional materials we can use? world assistance for cambodia/japan relief for cambodia does not produce printed promotional materials but donors are welcome to use materials on our website for promotional activities. please feel free to contact us for questions or further information. other medical projects ratanakiri telemedicine robib telemedicine rehabilitation center new project provide medical care to the poor and needy in cambodia launched in 1995, the sihanouk hospital center of hopefills a critical need for poor cambodians with limited options for health care. the hospital, located in central phnom penh, provides free medical consultation, treatment and medications to the poor and builds the capacity of the cambodian health care system through education and clinical training of medical professionals. the hospital is staffed by cambodian doctors and nurses with training and support from expatriate volunteers. it has strong partnerships with international research organizations and provides care through outpatient clinics and home-based outreach programs. there are basic needs at the hospital that require ongoing operational support: emergency department: the resource-constrained health care delivery system in rural cambodia doesnt meet the needs of residents of the provinces outside of phnom penh. the emergency department provides immediate triage and treatment for thousands of patients each year that arrive with no other options for care. is the average cost to triage and treat a patient in the emergency room. medications: patients receive authentic, reliable medications, an important treatment in a country where counterfeit medicines are a common occurrence. will provide for a proven intravenous antibiotic used to combat severe and complicated infection. medical ward: patients with complex infections and complications from undiagnosed chronic health conditions and frequently require hospitalization to ensure an effective recovery. a donation will cover the cost of two peoples stay in the medical ward. if you would like to help or have other suggestions for donations, please contact us. about us faq our programs bright future kids girls be ambitious rural schools program sihanouk hospital center of hope give donate contact for neglected diseases our mission is to save and improve the sight and lives of the worlds vulnerable. feature hki a top charity second year in a row helen keller international is proud to announce that we have been rated a top charity by givewell for the second year in a row for our vitamin a supplementation program. read more latest updates a milestone in vision care one in four children in the united states needs eyeglasses but doesnt have them. on february 4, we completed our two millionth free u.s. vision screening at an after-school program for students in new york city. read more year in review as we welcome the opportunities of 2019, we also take a look back at 2018, highlighting our most inspiring moments from our programs around the world. read more the changing climate for zero hunger over the past two months, the international community has been informed by new data, and new warnings, about the drivers of global hunger and the number of people worldwide who suffer from malnutrition. read more where we work connect with us join us and receive updates from hki first name last name email by signing up, you agree to helen keller international's privacy policy make a empowering communities to protect their health and environment through the sustainable use of water resources. overview the living earth institute is a seattle-based non-profit 501(3)(c) organization founded in to aid international communities in developing sustainable water resources. our primary focus is the development of water supply and sanitation projects; however, through experience, we know that in order to make these projects sustainable, we must take a holistic approach. this means that we work with the community to implement income generation training, micro-lending programs, literacy classes, hygiene education, and other programs to meet community-defined needs the living earth institute martin luther king jr. wy seattle, wa 861-6801 pamelardo@gmail.com sanitation learn more who we are the living earth institute was founded by a small group of people in seattle in 1999. all lei board members are volunteers, allowing donations to go directly to the communities we serve. pam elardo, p.e. president a professional engineer with over years experience in regional and international infrastructure development. she first worked as a water supply and sanitation engineer in nepal as a peace crops volunteer in the early 1980s. since then, she has worked in the environmental engineering field with the washington state department of ecology, then as the director of the king county regional wastewater treatment utility, and is currently serving as the deputy commissioner of the new york city bureau of wastewater treatment. in 1999, she co-founded the living earth institute and has been actively involved ever since. pratistha kansakr vice president shanti thapa treasurer amanda wager secretary with years of experience working in the non-profit sector, and a masters degree in social work from nyu, amanda wager brings to the board both perspective and passion. since her first steps in kathmandu in 2013, amanda has immersed herself in finding nonprofits that work with the communities of nepal. once living earth institute was discovered by amanda, there was no turning back. by the fall of 2013, amanda was on the board with lei, serving as their secretary. going to nepal and seeing first hand the work that lei does, is outstanding. through this experience more opportunities has arisen and amanda now serves on the board of the bo m karlsson foundation; empowering women through education. while she enjoys the active life she has built in seattle, she looks forward to enrich the country she considers her connect with us facebook instagram doctype html cheap volunteer abroad programs: wide variety of authentic projects toggle navigation who we are why iko poran destinations projects fees community talk to us apply now cheap volunteering abroad! real meaningful projects in countries 20+ amazing locations program fees starting at only us$ 150.00 per week!! iko poran volunteer abroad world's most affordable best-rated volunteer abroadprograms who we are? ikpva offers a wide range of cheap volunteer abroad programs so more people with good intentions can travel to lean a hand. iko poran volunteer abroad ikpva, is a local non-profit brazilian volunteer organization founded in in rio de janeiro, brazil, a developing country. iko poran mission: to format implement volunteer abroad programs that cause a positive impact on the projects in which they take place, promoting intercultural exchanges and strengthening a growing number of local organizations and development initiatives worldwide. why so affordable? we keep the overheads costs low because we cooperatedirectly with our partners in the destinations and because we are a non-profit local organization, we do not charge any extra handling fee! our volunteers overseas have a unique experienceby actively participating in developing local initiatives for a fairer world for all. please check out some reviews and see pictures of our amazing volunteers on our community page south africa animal conservation volunteer where can you get involved as a volunteer overseas? how dowe do? the local coordinators will go the extra mile and beyond to help you make a long-lasting difference in the volunteer project where you will be placed. at the same time, they are always there when needed to make sure you are having a meaningful experience. our grassroots partner organizations develop a communication with our volunteers overseas to get them involved with their projects even before they arrive. with the right preparation, your volunteer abroad program will be unique and productive. where can you go? because our goal is to strengthen local projects, as stated on our mission, we only offer our cheap volunteer abroad programs in developing countries in asia, africa, and latin america, and also in pioneer initiatives, like the urban vegetable garden project in marseille, france, that is coming out soon. our cheap volunteer abroad programs are available in asia, africa and latin america: argentina brazil cambodia colombia costa rica ecuador ethiopia ghana india kenya nepal peru south africa tanzania thailand and uganda teach english in a buddhist monastery in nepal unexpected, long lasting, and unique experience side by side with locals. what can you do? you can choose from a wide range of cheap volunteer abroad programs in many areas. our variety of programs include teaching childcare community development medical construction women empowerment business development sports arts animal preservation it, environment protection and many other projects to match all skills and interests. who run the volunteer programs? our local partner organizations and their community councils develop and operate social projects that you can join to help our cheap volunteer abroad programs. local people that put their souls into the initiative are always in touch supporting our volunteers and measuring their positive results in the projects. what are the benefits? the exchange of experiences, opinions, and knowledge opens up new horizons and opportunities for everyone involved. the programs provide training for volunteers and communities, generate income and employment, and do so in an open ethical manner by sharing the revenues with local projects. jungle community immersion project in peru apply now! cheap volunteer salvador, y el delta del estero real, en nicaragua. si bien estos sitios tienen algn tipo de proteccin nominal, carecen hasta el momento de procesos eficaces para su conservacin y estn amenazados por la prdida de hbitat, degradacin, contaminacin y uso no sostenible de los recursos. es por eso que la oficina ejecutiva de la red hemisfrica de reservas para las aves playeras ha puesto en marcha el proyecto construyendo capacidad para conservacin de sitios prioritarios para las aves playeras en centroamrica gracias al apoyo del u.s. fish and wildlife service of international conservation, wildlife without borders latin america and caribbean) este proyecto tiene como meta apoyar la gestin y proteccin efectiva de los mencionados sitios, a travs de la construccin de capacidad local en los actores locales e interesados directos. a travs de procesos participativos, se identificarn las principales amenazas y sus drivers en cada sitio y se desarrollarn planes de accin para abordarlos. se proveern adems herramientas a los actores locales para implementar buenas prcticas de gobernanza en cada sitio. la capacidad de los actores locales se est construyendo fundamentalmente a travs de una estrategia que combina un ciclo de talleres participativos y el acompaamiento tcnico permanente desde la oficina ejecutiva de la rhrap. se aplicar la herramienta de evaluacin de sitios rhrap en baha de jiquilisco en el salvador y de abril) y en delta del estero real, en nicaragua y de abril) y se llevar a cabo el curso-taller buena gobernanza para conservacin de sitios prioritarios para las aves playeras en centroamrica y de mayo en chinandega, nicaragua). adicionalmente, la oficina ejecutiva de la rhrap proporcionar acompaamiento permanente y asistencia tcnica a los actores locales de cada sitio, para articular y facilitar la construccin de mecanismos de buena gobernanza y la incorporacin de las aves playeras como un objeto de conservacin prioritario dentro de los acciones de manejo en las reas. se trabaja directamente con comunidades y lderes locales, municipios, ministerios, empresas privadas, administradores/manejadores, ongs, expertos e investigadores. el equipo de la oficina ejecutiva de la rhrap para este proyecto est integrado por rob clay, su director y los especialistas en conservacin, meredith gutowski morehouse y diego luna quevedo. la articulacin y gestin local es liderada por marta quezada, directora de ecosistemas de salvanatura, en el salvador y por salvadora morales, directora ejecutiva de quetzalli, en nicaragua. adems de fortalecer capacidades locales, este proyecto espera construir nuevos acuerdos de conservacin y mecanismos de gobernanza que permitan mejorar el manejo de estos sitios crticos para las aves playeras en centroamrica. adicionalmente vehculos son motocicletas acomodadas con un asiento y techo en la parte trasera, donde se puede llevar a una o dos personas. las moto-taxis viajan relativamente a baja velocidad y si se va con equipaje, slo podrn llevar a una persona por moto-taxi. los turistas pueden rentar el servicio de una moto-taxi para ir desde cara sucia a los sectores san benito o san francisco menndez. el costo podra estar entre us$ 10, o hasta 20, pues depende del arreglo que se haga con el chofer del moto-taxi. salvanatura no tiene ninguna regulacin o responsabilidad sobre los cobros de transporte que las moto-taxis puedan hacer a los turistas, as que ser conveniente que el turista converse con el chofer del moto-taxi al estar en cara sucia, antes de dirigirse hacia algn sector del parque. km planes de cancelar un monto de por hectrea del cultivo en fincas individuales y por hectrea en certificacin de grupo. inversin para las mejoras: son asumidas por cada finca o empresa de acuerdo a su plan de mejoras. 3. planificacin de auditoras: al recibir la aceptacin de la cotizacin y su pago, salvanatura elabora un plan de auditoras donde se describen los objetivos, alcances, metodologa as como el establecimientos de las fechas para las auditoras. este plan debe ser aprobado por el productor para iniciar su ejecucin. 4. decisin de la certificacin: finalmente, el productor recibe la respuesta videos search for: descripcin este es un instrumento promotor de buenas prcticas socioambientales que busca que las entidades del sector pblico y privado alcancen la sostenibilidad comprobada a travs de procesos de verificacin y certificacin. justificacin nace de la necesidad de: reconocer el trabajo que hacen las entidades a favor del medio ambiente, promover el desarrollo sostenible por medio de los servicios que brinda salvanatura, contar con un mecanismo de mejora continua para comprobar la dedicacin y buena planificacin de las empresas. objetivo principal brindar un instrumento para promover, comprobar y reconocer a las entidades pblicas y privadas, que estn comprometidas con el desarrollo sostenible de el salvador y la regin mesoamericana. objetivos secundarios incidir positivamente en la planificacin e implementacin de acciones empresariales para la adaptacin al cambio climtico. reducir impactos ambientales desde la fuente. contribuir al cumplimiento de los objetivos del milenio, en los aspectos ambientales y sociales. promover y elevar la gestin y buenas prcticas socio-ambientales en los diferentes sectores econmicos de la regin. promover hbitos y costumbres ambiental y socialmente responsables en los mercados de productos y servicios. fortalecer la competitividad empresarial en los diferentes sectores econmicos. promover la transparencia y confidencialidad. alcance reconocer el compromiso de las buenas prcticas en los procesos de las entidades del sector pblico y privado. a travs de una solicitud de servicio, la empresa puede escoger la entidad al enfocarse, puede ser la entidad en su totalidad, sucursales, departamentos, reas, entre otros. recomendamos siempre incluir su totalidad ya que habr resultados mayores. norma y proceso del programa de compromiso socio-ambiental el programa es conformado de una norma de buenas prcticas socio-ambientales que incluyen tres pilares fundamentales: clima y mitigacin) las entidades participantes, conscientes de los riesgos y vulnerabilidades de su entorno, identifican, planifican y ejecutan acciones para adaptarse eficazmente a condiciones adversas resultantes del cambio climtico y desarrollan mecanismos que aseguran que sus procesos conllevan a una reduccin de los gases de efecto invernadero. la implementacin de un programa de eficiencia energtica, el uso de energa renovable y los procesos de produccin ms limpia son acciones que contribuyen a mitigar los efectos del cambio climtico. paisaje y biodiversidad) las entidades participantes demuestran un compromiso permanente con la conservacin de la biodiversidad y recursos naturales conexos, y reconocen que los servicios ecosistmicos que estos generan son fundamentales en la ejecucin de sus procesos y aportan beneficios para las personas y las comunidades. estos objetivos se concretan mediante la implementacin de programas de proteccin de la biodiversidad, proteccin y uso responsable del agua, manejo integral de residuos y reduccin de las sustancias txicas. sociedad y fuerza laboral) las entidades participantes, se involucran en las necesidades de las comunidades, para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus miembros a travs de la ejecucin de proyectos sociales propios y/o en cooperacin con grupos de inters. tambin desarrollan mecanismos para optimizar su productividad, por medio de la implementacin de prcticas que motiven a su personal a apropiarse de los objetivos de responsabilidad ambiental empresarial. los clientes y los proveedores son participantes necesarios para la consolidacin de negocios sostenibles. con estos pilares las organizaciones podrn desarrollar acciones que les permitan ser sostenibles, consiguiendo por medio de ellos mejoras en la productividad, eficiencia en sus procesos y por consiguiente contribuir a la sostenibilidad financiera de la empresa. cada pilar cuenta con diferentes criterios que buscan la sostenibilidad de la empresa, cada criterio tiene tres indicadores los cuales buscan la mejora continua. la norma cuenta con tres niveles de cumplimiento, estos se logran en base a la cantidad de indicadores que la organizacin cumpla. los tres niveles de cumplimiento son: sostenible, emergente sostenible, avanzado sostenible, sobresaliente proceso el proceso del programa consta de los siguientes pasos: paso 1: la entidad enva solicitud de participacin en la cual se define el alcance de la evaluacin. paso 2: salvanatura revisa la solicitud y enva presupuesto, plan de trabajo propuesta y acuerdo de servicio. paso 3: la entidad enva aprobacin de presupuesto, el acuerdo de servicio firmado y realiza el primer pago de servicio. paso 4: salvanatura realiza un diagnstico de la entidad en base a la norma de compromiso socio-ambiental de salvanatura este diagnstico es una asistencia tcnica a la empresa que incluye un asesor tcnico que trabajar con la administracin de la empresa para identificar buenas prcticas existentes y dar recomendaciones en otras. paso 5: el asesor elabora el informe del diagnstico y en base a los resultados recomendar la empresa para su primera auditoria. paso 6: la entidad revisa informe y aprueba la participacin en la auditoria. paso 7: un auditor de salvacert realiza la auditoria y un informe de resultados. paso 8: la entidad revisa informe, aprueba y realiza segundo pago. paso 9: salvanatura entregar la confirmacin del nivel de certificacin del programa, extender un certificado y reconocer a la entidad en eventos de divulgacin y a travs de diferentes medios. contacto: salvanatura inici el proyecto con la creacin de un corral de incubacin de huevos de tortugas marinas de golfina, ubicado en la playa costa del sol, de acuerdo a los lineamientos legales establecidos por el ministerio de medio ambiente y recursos naturales objetivos mejorar el estado de conservacin de las tortugas marinas en el salvador, apoyando los esfuerzos de conservacin regional. promover el establecimiento de modelos adecuados de viveros para proyectos nuevos y existentes. facilitar una herramienta tcnica para monitorear, evaluar y dar seguimiento a los procesos de conservacin de tortugas marinas. promover la proteccin, conservacin y recuperacin de las poblaciones de tortugas marinas y del hbitat del que dependen a travs de la educacin ambiental. involucrar a las comunidades en la conservacin de la especie y en las oportunidades de turismo derivadas de las acciones de conservacin. es necesario que todos colaboremos a la conservacin de las tortugas marinas, evitando el consumo de sus huevos, no matando tortugas adultas que se encuentren en las playas, no contaminando los mares, apoyando a los viveros para no perder el equilibrio en el ecosistema y que las nuevas generaciones puedan apreciarlas. colabora con salvatortuga! existen alternativas en nuestro programa donde pueden participar: 1. liberaciones publicas, cuya donacin es de por persona pudiendo liberar una tortuguita, las fechas se publican en las redes sociales. la donacin es el da del evento en el vivero de incubacin ubicado en la costa del sol, restaurante hola betos. 3. liberaciones privadas, para grupos familiares o empresas dependiendo de la cantidad de personas que estn interesadas en participar se elabora una propuesta de donacin para su aprobacin con fecha y hora para realizarla. 2. adopcinde nidos, tiene un costo de que es loque se estima cuesta mantener huevos en incubacin por el tiempo necesario hasta su eclosin. con esta alternativa puede depositar su donacin en la cuenta del banco agrcola nmero 500-018410-8, enviarnos el comprobante de depsito a info@salvanatura.org con los datos de nombre completo y nit del donante para emitirle su certificado de donacin o acercarse a la oficina de salvanatura en finca vista alegre, km 1/2 planes de renderos, san salvador. salvanatura le informara cuando ha sido incubado el nido adoptado por usted, la cantidad de huevos y la fecha probable de eclosin, segn la espacie de tortuga. coordinaramos la liberacin de su grupo segn los nacimientos de los nidos.pudiendo participar hasta8 personas. contacto: t: e: info@salvanatura.org km octubre del 2015, se llev a cabo la firma del convenio entre banco procredit y la fundacin ecolgica de el salvador, salvanatura para responder a este convenio, banco procredit pone a disposicin de todos los interesados una opcin de financiamiento verde, amigable con el medio ambiente, conocida como ecocrdito; el cual es una opcin innovadora que fue lanzada en septiembre de 2013. con este producto, se fomentan principalmente proyectos relacionados con eficiencia energtica, energa renovable y otras medidas de proteccin ambiental que generan ahorro de energa, materiales y recursos; y a la vez efectos positivos adicionales que impulsan la proteccin del medio ambiente entre el sector empresarial. adems, cuenta con una unidad medio ambiental especializada en el tema y con ejecutivos preparados para analizar cada caso y asesorar de manera integral a sus clientes. por medio del ecocrdito, banco procredit busca mejorar la modernizacin, productividad, innovacin y competitividad de las pequeas y medianas empresas salvadoreas. de igual forma, reafirma su compromiso de apoyar los proyectos de ahorro y financiamiento de cada uno de sus clientes, ofrecindoles una gama de productos y servicios complementarios como cuentas corrientes, cuentas de ahorro y banca en lnea. en el evento participaron meik proescher, gerente general y sal lvarez, gerente de negocios, ambos de banco procredit; lvaro moiss c., director ejecutivo y walter jockisch, presidente, ambos de salvanatura, quienes tuvieron conversaciones previas a la firma del convenio, en las que coincidieron en que el objetivo de apoyar al medio ambiente con opciones de financiamiento es similar para las instituciones, lo cual dio origen a esta iniciativa. para mayor informacin pueden visitar el sitio web www.bancoprocredit.com.sv o llamar al centro de atencin al cliente 7676. km planes de renderos, finca vista alegre, san salvador, el salvador, c.a. t: c: derechos reservados salvanatura press f for espino bosque los pericos, mejor conocido como parque del bicentenario, es la primera rea natural protegida que se sita en la zona metropolitana del gran san salvador, especficamente en el valle de las hamacas, de la cadena volcnica de la vertiente pacfica del norte de centroamrica. el parque se encuentra en la zona de vida de bosque hmedo sub-tropical. hasta el momento en que pasa a ser rea natural protegida, su suelo era utilizado para cultivar caf bajo sombra 1975). su elevacin se encuentra entre los y metros sobre el nivel del mar, lo que hace que the nature conservancy la ubique en las zonas bajas de la eco-regin de los bosques hmedos de la sierra madre de chiapas. por el momento, el parque no recibe la visita de turistas, ya que se encuentra en un proceso de adecuacin de infraestructura administrativa y para fines educativos como recreativos. en su interior viven los habitantes de la comunidad la unin ii, quienes participan en los esfuerzos de proteccin del rea, en actividades como manejo de desechos slidos, trabajos temporales y educacin ambiental. horarios hbiles de lunes a domingo horario del parque del bicentenario: 6:00 a.m. 6:00 p.m. horario de ciclova y media boletines eventos noticias galera de fotos videos search for: por decreto legislativo, el espino bosque los pericos fue declarado zona protectora del suelo y zona de reserva forestal y entregado en proindiviso a las alcaldas municipales de san salvador y antiguo cuscatln. por decreto ejecutivo es declarado rea natural protegida. tiene una categora de manejo de parque ecolgico y uno de sus objetivos de manejo es la conservacin de los servicios ecosistmicos que presta a la sociedad, principalmente al rea metropolitana de san salvador. salvanatura trabaja de manera conjunta con las municipalidades de san salvador y de antiguo cuscatln en el manejo y desarrollo de el espino bosque los pericos. fue abierto al pblico y nombrado parque del bicentenario en conmemoracin de los doscientos aos del primer grito de independencia. desde entonces, es un espacio para la recreacin, el deporte, el estudio y la investigacin, adems de otros beneficios ecosistmicos que brinda a la sociedad. fue aprobado por el ministerio de medio ambiente y recursos naturales el plan de manejo del rea natural protegida el espino bosque los pericos, elaborado de manera participativa con la facilitacin de salvanatura nuestra fundacin ejecuta los diferentes programas de manejo que proponen la restauracin y conservacin de la biodiversidad y dems recursos naturales en el rea; ofrecer condiciones y facilidades para que los visitantes accedan y disfruten del rea; contribuir al desarrollo de conciencia ambiental en la ciudadana, resguardar los recursos biolgicos y la seguridad de los visitantes. km planes de renderos, finca vista alegre, san salvador, el salvador, c.a. t: c: derechos reservados salvanatura press f for fullscreen. html boletines salvanatura salvanatura fundacin ambiental, social y cultural en los sectores agrcola, turismo y silvicultura. salvacert naci en y posee ms de aos de experiencia en la verificacin de cultivos agrcolas. hoy en da, salvacert ha ampliado su programa de verificacin y certificacin hacia los rubros turstico y forestal, debido a las nuevas tendencias de integracin de los valores de sostenibilidad en el mundo empresarial. los estndares que promueve son respaldados por normativas reconocidas internacionalmente. estos favorecen la competitividad de las operaciones y el posicionamiento de sus marcas en el mercado mundial. con el objetivo de mejorar los procesos internos y de garantizar un servicio de calidad a sus clientes, salvacert implementa un sistema de calidad en cumplimiento a la norma iso 17020-2000 en todos sus procesos. km planes de renderos, finca vista alegre, san salvador, el salvador, c.a. t: c: derechos reservados salvanatura press f for fullscreen. html pnlv recomendaciones salvanatura salvanatura esta categora es equivalente a la categora ii de uicn. es un rea protegida, manejada principalmente para la conservacin de ecosistemas y proporciona un marco para actividades culturales con fines de recreacin. debe contener ejemplos representativos de importantes regiones, caractersticas o escenarios naturales, en las cuales especies de animales y plantas, los hbitats y los sitios geomorfolgicos, revistan especial importancia ecolgica, cientfica, educativa, cultural, recreativa y turstica. debe cubrir una extensin tal que incluya uno o ms ecosistemas que no hayan sido alterados significativamente de la ley de reas naturales, el salvador, 2005). objetivos de manejo mantener los bienes y servicios ambientales fomentar la educacin ambiental e interpretacin de la naturaleza promover la investigacin cientfica contribuir al ecoturismo y la recreacin utilizar sosteniblemente los recursos derivados de los ecosistemas naturales mantener los atributos culturales y tradicionales salvanatura trabaja arduamente para conseguir fuentes de financiamiento que ayuden a la ejecucin de los objetivos y programas de manejo de el imposible y de desarrollo sostenible de las comunidades cercanas al parque. co-manejo en salvanatura firm un convenio de cooperacin tcnica entre el marn de medio ambiente y recursos naturales), para fortalecer, coordinar y consolidar la gestin de el imposible mediante la ejecucin de programas y subprogramas del plan de manejo y bajo la figura de co-manejo. como organizacin co-manejadora de el imposible, salvanatura busca promover y ejecutar actividades de proteccin, conservacin, restauracin y manejo sostenible de los recursos naturales de este parque que es actualmente el foco de mayor biodiversidad y belleza escnica en el salvador. zonas de amortiguamiento su importancia radica en que en ella se deben promover las actividades amigables con los recursos naturales que apoyen los objetivos de manejo y minimicen los impactos negativos hacia adentro y afuera del parque, a travs de educacin ambiental, el fomento de tecnologas apropiadas y el turismo. la regin de influencia es el espacio territorial que directamente recibe los beneficios y servicios ambientales del parque, como son el agua, belleza escnica, biodiversidad y reservorio de carbono capta carbono-. tiene un rea de 58,954 hectreas y est formada por los municipios de san francisco menndez, tacaba, jujutla y guaymango, quienes afectan recprocamente al desarrollo. zonas de manejo zona intangible: constituye el 77% de bosque. no se utiliza para visitacin turstica o trnsito sin previa autorizacin para preservar los procesos ecolgicos. slo mediante una autorizacin, se pueden realizar proyectos de investigacin, preservacin, conservacin y monitoreo. a esta zona pertenecen los cerros campana, piedra del filo, el pulguern, la olla, izcanal, monte hermoso, las pulgas, la cumbre, la leoncita y mixtepe, el mirador el puma, la cueva de cal y el corozo. zona de uso intensivo: forma el 6% del bosque, donde se fomenta la recreacin turstica y la educacin-comunicacin ambiental, tratando de causar el mnimo impacto en el ambiente natural y considerando los aspectos estticos. en l se incluyen el centro de visitantes mixtepe, mirador el mulo y la entrada al sector san francisco menndez. cada sector puede admitir hasta turistas como mximo diariamente. zona de uso extensivo: es un 17% del bosque en el que se mantiene un ambiente natural con un mnimo de impacto humano. el manejo controlado de esta zona permite el turismo y paseos el clima es fresco, en promedio ronda los a 8c, aunque puede variar bruscamente a un ambiente ms clido, este cambio depende en gran medida a la luz solar. al principio o final del da, como cuando hay presencia de nubes, la temperatura desciende, al igual que con el viento. un da normal, se puede disfrutar de un clima entre a 24c. en los meses de mayo a octubre llueve copiosamente, por lo que se recomienda acampar en los meses restantes. el parque nacional los volcanes es el rea natural protegida en el salvador, que comprende tres de los volcanes jvenes millones y aos, de acuerdo a los gelogos) de la cordillera apaneca-ilamatepec: volcn de santa ana, izalco y cerro verde, en los departamentos de santa ana y sonsonate. al ubicarse en el extremo oriental de la cordillera, los volcanes se convierte en un importante corredor biolgico junto al parque nacional el imposible occidental). esto significa que las especies de vida silvestre tienen un puente que utilizan para transitar de un parque a otro, a lo largo de kilmetros de cafetales bajo sombra y selvas de tierras altas. por tal motivo, el salvador identifica a los volcanes entre sus reas naturales prioritarias de conservacin. tiene una extensin de 4,500 hectreas, entre tierras estatales, municipales y privadas. posee elevaciones que oscilan entre los y 2,381 metros sobre el nivel del mar. el parque se encuentra inmerso dentro de lo que hoy se conoce como reserva de la biosfera apaneca-ilamatepec, declarada con esta denominacin por la unesco unidas para la educacin, ciencia y la cultura) el ao 2007. el complejo est en una zona que se caracteriza por la produccin de caf, la cual es una actividad econmica importante para los habitantes locales. adems, se producen granos bsicos, flores, miel, existe la actividad ganadera, y muy a lo lejos, caa de azcar. volcn de izalco a travs de la historia, este coloso era llamado el faro del pacfico debido a que serva de gua por la noche para los barcos que navegaban por las costas salvadoreas. sin csar y por casi aos, el volcn ofreca un espectculo de cascadas de lava y rocas al rojo vivo lanzadas al aire, que caan sin provocar mayor peligro en los sembrados al pie del volcn. esta actividad lleg a formar un cono de metros sobre la llanura vecina metros sobre el nivel del mar), con un crter de metros de dimetro. volcn cerro verde en el salvador se le conoce simplemente como cerro verde, pero en realidad se trata de un volcn que naci aproximadamente 1.5 millones de aos atrs y tuvo su ltima erupcin hace unos mil aos. tiene una altura aproximada de 2,030 msnm, y su crter se encuentra erosionado y cubierto por bosque nebuloso mediana perennifolia), por lo que el turista puede confundirlo con un cerro. volcn de santa ana o ilamatepeq de la vieja) es el mayor de los volcanes del complejo y el tercer punto ms alto de el salvador. tiene una elevacin de 2,381 msnm. su historia geolgica se remonta a unos millones de aos, con erupciones irregulares, tal es el caso que ilamatepec demostr su fuerza en el ao 2005, con una erupcin que destruy vegetacin, poblados y cultivos. por ms de ao y medio el sistema de proteccin civil prohibi las visitas tursticas u otro tipo de actividad en las inmediaciones del coloso, debido a que permaneca activo y en potencial peligro para la zona. contacto: telfono: 2202-1515 e-mail: info@salvanatura.org km planes de seco y tropical seco premontano), pero tambin por ser uno de los ltimos refugios para una comunidad increblemente diversa de vida silvestre, fuente de recursos hdricos para la zona y poseedor de videos search for: en 2006, scientified certification systems otorg asalvanaturala aprobacin como organismo verificador para el programa coffee and farmer equity(c.a.f.e., por sus siglas en ingls) practices de starbucks. scs es una empresa contratada por starbucks coffee company para asegurar la calidad de las auditoras y de los informes que se realicen para c.a.f.e. practices, por parte del verificador.salvanaturaes la verificadora aprobada para ofrecer este servicio en el salvador, honduras y nicaragua. los lineamientos generales de evaluacin de c.a.f.e. practices son un conjunto de criterios ambientales, sociales y econmicos que los auditores de nuestra fundacin deben evaluar en el manejo de las fincas y beneficios de caf. gracias a este programa, las tiendas de starbucks alrededor del mundo, adquieren un caf de alta calidad, producido responsablemente. al igual quesalvanatura, starbucks cree que el caf puede y debe producirse, beneficiarse y comercializarse en forma tal que genere mejoras econmicas y sociales, y a la vez, proteja al medio ambiente. el productor que cumpla con los criterios de este programa podr vender su caf a mejores precios y tener acceso a mercados que hacen negocios a largo plazo. desea que su produccin de caf sea reconocida y recompensada por c.a.f.e. practices de starbucks? 1. comunquese de con el personal del certificacin sostenible de salvanatura y reciba la orientacin sobre este servicio. 2. el productor contacta con el personal del programa c.a.f.e. practices de starbucks. 3. starbucks hace una prueba de calidad del caf. para ello, el productor debe enviar una muestra del caf producido. 4. si la muestra de caf cumple con los requisitos de calidad de starbucks, el productor recibe un cdigo y se somete a los criterios de verificacin. esta verificacin es realizada por salvanatura, entidad legalmente avalada por starbucks. 5. si la finca o beneficio cumple con los criterios, el productor recibe un premio en efectivo, que vara de acuerdo al puntaje alcanzado en la verificacin realizada por los auditores. contacto: telfono: 2202-1501 e-mail: info@salvacert.org km planes de renderos, finca vista alegre, san salvador,
